description:
Not a secure implementation. If one of these generated passwords is compromised, an adversary can attempt to brute force your master password. If/when they succeed, ALL passwords are compromised.

It is much safer to have a database that can be protected. Generated passwords are given to websites and other services... can you really trust them?

I would like to make a note on the algorithm which is criticized in this review section. I had similar concerns and the white-paper did stop my concerns. After this comment I again wanted to ask about its security:
https://chat.spectre.app/d/46-security-critism
The develper of the algorithm commented on it.
(Spectre is just the rebranded name for masterpassword. It is the same algorithm used in this app.)
